reviews.text:
Brought several large bags full of flattened soft drink cans. I drove around the left side after entering the place and parked. A forklift brought a metal bin and laid it a few feet behind my vehicle. I dumped all my bags into it. They moved the bin onto a scale and sent the info to the office. At the office window, the clerk asked for my license plate number. After providing the first 3 digits of my plate number, she handed me a receipt with cash.

Very easy process. I was there for less than 1

Thieves work at the scale. Took (tare) 7lbs for two plastic buckets that weigh less than 0.5lbs each. Also price was crazy low, 3.65 when current spot is 4.20 I know it’s usually 20-30 cents under but 55 cents under is crazy!!! Go elsewhere!!! I know I had exactly 70lbs and 20lbs yet paid 66lbs for #1 copper and 18lbs for thhn copper. Thieves!!!
Loved yalls fast service and pays good. People there are friendly and helpful. Thank yall!!!

The girl behind the counter was extremely rude! I questioned their pricing and she said I wasn’t welcome there. She asked to take my picture 3 times!! Worst service I’ve experienced from a recycling center!
Great place to drop off your metals, old nails, screws, pipes, even empty properly party helium tank.  Nice & polite employees.
The loaders are so nice and very helpful.  Been here many times

I brought in several boxes of scrap aluminum, copper, brass, etc that I'd collected at home over the years.  It's a little confusing when you're coming in for the first time and don't know the protocol, but everyone I asked was helpful and pointed out where to go at each step of the process.  I started by pulling up to the ramp on the right (west) side of the main building.  The lady at the window asked what kind of material I was bringing in, and then directed me to park over on the opposite (e
Great scrapyard, great service, great prices!

Went here for the first time 1,18,2025.
Was cleaning out the garage and thought about recycling instead of just trash day.
This place was the closest. I parked, the forklift driver brought a container over, I separated the items, he took the container to the scales (they weigh everything right in front of you).
Took my ticket to the office and got a check for the items.
Easy peasy. Everyone was nice what more could you ask for.

Thanks DFW Recyclers!
I'm going to have to say that they were fast, and they were very efficient, an incredibly competent. I like how patient they were with me. I would recommend DFW recyclers to anyone.
Excellent customer service and professionalism. Easy to get in and out, and every truck is a priority! Highly recommend

This place is a rip off. Very bad grading of computer boards and other e waste. Save your time. I have been dealing with e scrap  for a few years so I know the grades. Took a sample size of about 100lbs of  various grade boards . Ended up with $69 check?????? WTH?? I didn’t even argue . Not worth the headache. But I knew I was never going back. I was looking for a local yard that would pay a fair price instead of having to ship them. This is not it. You are better off shipping to boardsort or ot
Efficient. Fast. Good service. I’d go back.
Good prices, nice staff, and fast service. Will definitely be coming here again!

Got there today and was in and out in 15 minutes and signed up for a cash card. Was help by three people explaining where i needed to go and expect my next visit to being under 15 minutes, great prices and very good customer service. Joann was a great help at the window.

Check your receipt they will put down cheaper metal to pay you less.  then when you call them out on it they willing to fix but if you don't then too bad. It was not the point of the money because I was just trying to get rid of it. But 7.00 for a exhaust pipe with catalytic converter, what I look like . But those trying to get your a fair deal this is not the place. Good idea to have someone that speaks Spanish with you.
The prices over the phone are good. I weigh my # 1 copper before taking it. On their scale showed 50 lbs less. It's not a way to do business.

We scrap metal almost on a daily basis for my junk removal company. After trying out many scrap yards in the area, this is our go to place. Friendly staff and very willing to answer questions. They recently dropped off a dumpster for us for a large commercial Cleanout of industrial equipment. Great communication, on-time delivery, and a quick turn around to pick it up. Quick and easy payout for their commercial clients and fair prices. Highly recommend.
Mario is a sweet heart and very helpful...full of info..been coming here for about 5 years and it's a smooth process

Very honest and straight forward company.  Came to the big demo we are doing and even helped show us to separate to get more money back in our pocket.  Will definitely use from here on out.  Id give more stars if I could.  Thank you, Grapevine Business Park.

Very helpful staff all around! Being my first visit, it was organized and very easy to navigate with help from the staff pointing in the right direction. I Will continue to bring my metals here weekly

I have been coming here for the past 3 years ,
good prices, the staff are kind and helpful especially nancy 😇. …

I went looking for scrap aluminum for a Halloween costume. I didn't find what I was looking for but everyone was super nice and helpful and they said they'd keep an eye out for something I can use and set it aside. It was honestly just fun to walk around and see what all they had i could see my friends and I exploring to get scraps for a project or something. It's honestly like a little gem.

I visited back when no gun was available, (I called to get pricing) but I am glad to hear that you can price out special alloys since you are much closer to me than my normal spot. I will try to stop by soon!

I just brought a load for the first time today.  I wasn’t sure what to do, but someone was quick to come and direct us.  Seemed simple enough, and staff were friendly,  but no one said anything about separating items so I’m not sure how that works, or if it is a flat fee.  Overall I would use this facility again.

Great place to be bring your metals. The staff is excellent and they take pride in the job. It is very convenient and the prices are good. The owner is a great man with a good personality. I recommend this place highly because of the great business.

If it wasn't for Google making it mandatory for a minimum of at least 1 star, I wouldn't put that. My issue isn't about you having a multicultural staff nor is it about whether you allow anyone to break down material on your property. This is solely about the discrimination I witness first hand while selling material to certain staff that work your small scale. It's ironic whenever the owner is on the small scale EVERYONE that comes through to sell metal on the small scale, it's a fair sell. The

I used to have to wait to go visit my parents in Garland to sell to a yard that didn't have to much.  Tried a few places on this side of town, but never had a great experience until I came to DFW recyclers.  I've been coming here steadily for over a year now.  Never a long wait, great setup for selling tin.  Employees are fair and a pleasure to interact with.  Highly recommend.

Very disappointed with the service.  I called two months in advance to ensure that a trailer would be available for a project and was told it was not an issue and to call back the week before.  Did just that and was told there were no trailer available even though we had called ahead of time

They paid us $1.80 for tin ($0.04 per pound) for the copper that was in the evaporator coil from an old AC unit because we had not separated the copper from the tin. I sent the unit with my two sons (20 and 18 years old) who didn't know that we were supposed to do that and were not told that either. He claims he has been in business twenty years but yet he didn't have the decency to inform the teens. I tried calling first thing the next day and finally made contact after not even being able to l
I like going here, it's an easy location to get to. Friendly & helpful staff. Quick to get in& out. Fair prices. My 1st choice scrap spot.

I was looking to buy scrap metal.  The office personnel just told me to be careful looking around.  This place has some some trash, but a lot of treasures.  I found the steel pipe for my Fusion Reactor, and it cost $9.  They have aluminum,  stainless, steel, and some chromed stuff, all generally sorted.  This is a good resource.  Most recyclers won't sell to the public, these folks say, "Come on down"!

VERY DISHONEST WORKERS! Receipt showed I brought 440 lb. Took it to another company where it weighed over 1800 lbs. They said they had mixed up the tickets but that's hard to believe since I was the only customer left. Even their "corrected" total of 1440 lbs was still 300 lbs short. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!
I've been there several times and never had a bad experience. That lady that runs the scales very helpful the guys Outback showing you where to unload will even help you.
Nancy is so cool and all the workers are friendly and super helpful, love this place
Integrity, helpful, educate you if you don’t know. Pay outs are better than several in the area.
Fast and Efficient. Ladies at the scales helped me out once I explained that it was my first time there. Large dump trailer friendly.

Fair price for your stuff. With prices so low right now you have to make sure that you sort out your scrap. Nobody will pay for tin as for copper. Extra pay for extra work. Make sure that you talk to people on site so you are on the same page when you are getting your money. Will come back to DFW Recyclers.
I take my scrap coils and copper here. They usually have a good rate and one of the scrap dudes gave me a cold water today. Thanks!
I've been bringing my scrap here for months. Always a fair scrap value and friendly service.
It is quick and easy to get in and out. They don't knit-pick your metal and they have fair and competitive prices.
DFW Recyclers was a pleasure to work with. Joanna and Team were very professional and coordinated well with us. Highly recommend them.

Everybody is friendly, even the owner.  He sure knows his metals.  Easy money.  That's where I'll take my scraps from now on.
Thank you DFW Recyclers

It's close to Home & all of the associates that work there are Friendly Folks that are very easy too deal with, even with a language barrier all you have too do is follow their hand signs on where to go.
Nancy was amazing and pricing was completely fair I will only use this place now on
I love this place.  Fast professional, courteous, fair.  People should recognize the important public service these guys deliver by recycling.  Thanks DFW Recycling
The employees here at dfw recyclers were very helpful. They help me unload my truck and the cashier was friendly and polite.
It's my go to place for all my pc part's and the workers there are very helpful. That is if ya understand Spanish.
Finally went  & sold aluminum today, didn't get as much as I thought I was going to get. I haven't sold a long time, so this brought back memories, when I used to go with my dad.
Great place to take your recycling. Great staff always a pleasure doing business with them
